text: The Adour (, ) is a river in southwestern France. It flows through the Occitanie and Nouvelle-Aquitaine regions. It starts in the Pyrenees, at the Arbizon mountain. It flows into the Atlantic Ocean (Bay of Biscay) near Bayonne. ==Geography== The Adour river has a length of .This is the length including the Adour de Payolle, following SANDRE, the French official organism; other organisms give a shorter length because they start to measure from the Campan valley, at the confluence of three small rivers. Its drainage basin has an area of approximately . ===Course=== The Adour river starts, as Adour de Payolle, at the north side of the Arbizon mountain. This river combines with the Adour de Gripp and the Adour de Lesponne to form the Adour river at Campan. The Adour flows north for almost through the Hautes-Pyrénées to Gers. There, it turns to the west and gets into the Landes department. In Port-de-Lanne, the Adour is joined by the Gaves réunis river. Finally, it flows into the Bay of Biscay, in the Atlantic Ocean, between Anglet (Pyrénées- Atlantiques) and Tarnos (Landes). Boats can travel on the river beginning about from its mouth. ==Tributaries of the Adour== Some of the important tributaries (longer than ) of the Adour are: Left tributaries: * Échez; * Lées; * Gabas; * Louts; * Luy; * Gaves réunis; (Gave de Pau ); * Bidouze; * Nive; Right tributaries * Arros, * Midouze; ==Towns along the river== Départements and towns found along the Adour river are: * Hautes-Pyrénées: Campan, Bagnères-de-Bigorre, Tarbes, Maubourguet * Gers: Riscle * Landes: Aire-sur-l'Adour, Dax, Tarnos * Pyrénées-Atlantiques: Bayonne == Hydrology == The average yearly discharge for the Adour river is at Saint-Vincent-de-Paul in the Landes department. The highest levels of the river are in winter and spring, from December to May inclusive, with the highest level in February.
